Girl.Action: Gives a little nod to her friend across the lecture hall in response to a text message.
Responds briefly and simply to friend's texts without elaboration.
Effortlessly manages to catch her phone sliding off the desk during a final exam, showing calmness and awareness under pressure.
Communicates concisely and clearly via text during an exam without apparent distraction or mistake.
Leans back and nods slightly to a friend, indicating composed and confident nonverbal communication in a stressful situation.
Waves to her friend after handing in the exam book.
Responds to friend's text messages with brief but friendly replies.
Responds to texts quickly and considers a suggestion to check the ride board, indicating adaptability and situational awareness.
Navigates the crowded exit efficiently despite being jostled, handing in exam and leaving calmly.
Hurries across mostly empty campus to reach the ride board, showing initiative and purposeful behavior.
Knocks on the guy's window, waking him up to ask about parking location, showing straightforwardness but little warmth.
Expresses frustration at being late and apologizes, showing sincerity and some self-awareness.
Scans the ride board notices to find a ride.
Knocks on the guy's car window to wake him and communicates clearly.
Realizes and admits she is two hours late.
Rolls her eyes but does not interrupt phone conversation.
Laughs and jokes on phone, showing lighthearted and friendly behavior.
Notices irritation from Guy and teases him by taking his picture, showing playful engagement.
Tries to strike up a conversation and extends an olive branch.
Mocks the guy's school name.
Turns on radio to Christmas music, creating a warm and pleasant atmosphere.
Engages in light, playful conversation about phrases and eye surgery with Guy, showing openness and friendliness.
Gives Guy a funny look when he asks to keep an eye out, indicating a playful and humorous interaction.
Asks the guy to pull over at the next gas station because she needs to pee, showing practical communication and self-advocacy.
Engages in casual conversation about the phrase 'keeping your eyes peeled' and corrects the guy firmly about laser use in eye surgery, demonstrating knowledge and confidence.
Paints her nails while riding in the car, which could show comfort or distraction but does not clearly demonstrate incompetence or high competence.
Turns on the radio and selects a Christmas music station, showing capability in managing the environment to be more comfortable.
Reveals she is having corrective eye surgery and calmly admits she is not worried.
Responds with suspicion when Guy points out the gas station.
Avoids leaving the car because her nails aren't dry, denying Guy's suggestion.
Confronts the guy about not hearing her banging when she was locked in, showing concern and seeking acknowledgment.
Offers the guy money for her half of the gas, demonstrating fairness and responsibility in shared expenses.
Frowns and follows the guy suspiciously after seeing him talking quietly with the clerk, showing distrust.
Questions if they are lost, indicating attentiveness and engagement.
Tries the passenger door handle to enter car, waits patiently for him to open it from inside despite it being stuck.
Expresses panic and insists on returning to the highway when car veers onto unknown, possibly unsafe road.
Watches him suspiciously out of the corner of her eye.
Explains why FM radio waves can't be received in the valley, suggesting AM instead.
Asks about his family's Christmas traditions, showing interest in his background.
Responds to the description of Sinterklaas with a dry 'Charming….'
Manages to articulate personal holiday struggles with clarity and humor, showing situational awareness.
Quickly spots inconsistency in Guy's story about locations and presses him on it, demonstrating sharp observation and critical thinking.
Demands answers and challenges Guy when confused by his evasiveness, taking initiative to clarify a confusing situation.
Scowls and reacts emotionally to Guy's response, which may suggest impatience or impulsiveness rather than calm reasoning.
Suggests pulling over to let the oncoming reckless driver pass.
Stirs and recovers from being thrown under the dash after the crash, slowly pieces together the situation and checks on the driver's condition.
Without hesitation, silently slips into her shoes and coat and begins searching for her cellphone to call for help.
Attempts to call 9-1-1 and repeatedly pleads for help despite no signal.
Screams and spins around when surprised by Guy's sudden presence, then explains herself honestly.
Expresses concern about Guy's condition and asks how he's doing.
Asks 'What now?' showing readiness to face the situation calmly.
Calls out 'Ready?' encouraging coordination with Guy.
Slips the car in gear and attempts to start the engine despite difficult conditions.
Responds promptly to commands and works with guy to try to free the car.
Asks 'What now?' after guy turns off flashlight, indicating uncertainty or need for direction.
Ransacks his suitcase and possessions looking for duct tape, holding scissors defensively.
Wipes a peephole on the fogged windshield to see outside, flicks on the headlights to get a better view.
Instinctively checks the power locks upon seeing the stranger, showing awareness and caution.
Gets out of the car holding scissors defensively, stands behind the car door for protection, and calls out to the stranger cautiously.
Moves out from behind the car door to follow the stranger while keeping a safe distance and trying to communicate effectively.
Screams upon seeing the stranger, indicating fear and possible panic.
Spooked, backs away cautiously from a mysterious figure, brandishes scissors defensively.
Keeps watchful eyes on both the man and the woods, showing alertness and assessing threats.
Refuses to immediately trust the guy despite his reassurances and questions inconsistencies.
Seems paranoid, clutches scissors tighter and doubts guy's explanation without concrete evidence.
Refuses to get into the car with the man she suspects is dangerous, shrieking at him.
Eventually gets into the car despite fear, choosing to trust him enough to take shelter rather than freeze outside.
Huddles as far away from the man as possible inside the car, brandishing scissors and eyeing him warily.
Figures out how the guy knew her travel plans by recalling earlier clues and piecing information together.
Initially fails to understand how the guy knew she needed a ride home, showing some confusion.
Apologizes sincerely and offers to pay back money to resolve conflict.
Engages in sarcastic, defensive banter with Guy, challenging his stereotypes.
Puts on the warmest clothes given by Guy, indicating trust and acceptance.
Smiles a little in the dark front seat despite discomfort, showing a friendly and good-natured side.
Climbs over Guy and puts hand on his chest to steady herself, indicating physical trust and closeness.
Responds testily to Guy's question about why she didn't pee earlier, showing some irritability and defensiveness.
Puts on the warmest clothing available, takes care to cover up properly in cold conditions.
Attempts to get comfortable in cramped, cold conditions by trying every position before sitting up.
Chooses not to go outside to pee initially, citing the extreme cold as the reason.
Uses the guy's chest to steady herself while climbing over him in a cramped space, indicating some lack of caution for his comfort or the situation.
Climbs out into bitter cold to relieve herself despite unpleasant conditions, showing practical self-management.
Keeps a wary eye out for the guy peeking, indicating alertness and awareness of surroundings.
Screams and falls backward in shock when seeing dark figures, showing fear and temporary loss of composure.
Decides to follow the dark figures rather than remain alone at the car, demonstrating courage and purposeful decision-making under stress.
Does not attempt to stop the dark figures or seek further help immediately, possibly missing an opportunity to act or communicate more effectively.
Decides to follow the guy despite being scared, showing loyalty and willingness to not leave him alone.
Suggests going back to the car when unsettled, showing concern for safety but yielding to guy's insistence.
Stops chasing, decides to return to car but gasps upon seeing a figure.
Shouts 'Wait!' to stop the stranger from leaving and pursues him.
Keeps pace with shuffling stranger to avoid losing him again.
Expresses shock and concern upon seeing the stranger's bound wrists and ankles.
Reaches toward the stranger, attempting to help despite the dangerous conditions.
Screams in terror upon witnessing the horrific sight of the stranger and the eel emerging from his throat.
Her screams and shock unconsciously alert the guy in the woods, indirectly prompting him to seek her out and check on her safety.
Screams in horror at the sight of the stranger and the emerging eel creature.
Her shock and screaming cause a disturbance but she is unable to act decisively or control the situation.
Uses duct tape and old newspapers to seal out the draft.
Asks the guy to hold her despite embarrassment, showing emotional awareness and seeking comfort.
Expresses fear about freezing to death instead of trying to distract herself or rationalize the situation.
Attempts to negotiate with the highway patrolman by offering money and appealing to his Christmas spirit despite the threatening situation.
Shows signs of fear and hesitation when confronted with the patrolman's intimidating and inappropriate behavior.
Does not push further or escalate the situation, seems unsure how to respond to the patrolman's ominous comments and demeanor.
Backs away timidly and shows terror, unable to assert herself against the patrolman.
Follows the patrolman's command to get in the car despite fear, showing some presence of mind in a threatening situation.
Beggs and pleads for release, demonstrating desperation but no effective resistance or strategic thinking.
Tries to take the crowbar out of the guy's frostbitten, injured hands despite the pain to herself.
Offers reassurances and practical help to the guy in pain.
Shows tolerance and understanding when the guy questions her first aid knowledge and defends herself sincerely.
Pours water over the guy's frostbitten hands to break the seal between skin and metal, prepares him for pain, and successfully removes the crowbar despite gag reflex.
Shows some uncertainty verbally ('What just... out there...?') and questions the reality of the event.
Diagnoses frostbite severity (second and third-degree) based on limited first aid knowledge from ski camp.
Takes immediate practical action to rewarm frostbitten hands carefully and gently.
Expresses fear and denial when confronted with a confusing, possibly supernatural event.
Questions and tries to understand the strange events even when scared.
Refuses to engage fully in the difficult conversation about what happened, showing resistance and avoidance.
Tries to take their minds off the grim situation by recalling the grocery items and imagining the meal, shares a hopeful wish for the future.
Expresses despair and sadness about the situation with tears.
Offers Tylenol-with-codeine from her purse to help Guy with his burning hands despite the difficult conditions.
Feels embarrassed about putting on her glasses while searching her purse, showing vulnerability and sincerity.
Tries to make herself comfortable and stay calm by fixing the duct tape despite the fear and cold.
Freezes and becomes scared, but does not lash out or respond aggressively to the supernatural or threatening events.
Kicks and screams when violently abducted.
Grabs duct tape and replaces old tape carefully despite shivering and yawning.
Freezes and holds still, scared to move or breathe when strange things happen (radio turning on/off, flickering light).
Surfaces from a terrifying dream with fear, then helps the guy by climbing up front to assist taping over the vents despite the danger.
Sits nervously watching her breath, unsure but tries to remain calm and shake off fear to comfort guy.
Claps a hand over Guy's mouth to stop his joking, expresses concern about ongoing danger, urges caution.
Claps a hand over Guy's mouth to stop his careless talk and warns that the threat might still be there, showing caution and presence of mind.
Expresses worry that the attacker could come back, showing vigilance but also anxiety.
Formulates a plan to get help by using nearby telephone infrastructure despite no cellphone signal.
Tries to convince herself to climb the telephone pole despite obvious danger, showing mental preparation and realistic self-assessment.
Expresses determination and refuses to just watch someone die, indicating confidence and resolve.
Encourages to listen carefully to the radio and makes a plan to signal with a yell, showing care and hope to protect or warn others.
Broods silently alone with the phone in lap before taking action, indicating some introspection or worry but willingness to act.
Engages in a hopeful, sincere conversation about fixing past mistakes and the opportunity to improve, showing optimism and openness.
Realizes the significance of the old Christmas song on the radio as a timing signal before 'he' shows up, demonstrating insight and quick connection of details.
Switches on the radio and prepares a plan to listen for a cue song and respond accordingly, showing preparedness and proactive behavior.
Prepares for a mission into the bitter cold by carefully disconnecting the telephone receiver, wrapping it, and securing it for safekeeping, indicating careful planning and readiness.
Broods on the phone without immediate action, potentially reflecting hesitation or indecision.
Pushes herself to continue despite harsh cold and fear while climbing the telephone pole to fix the junction box
Uses scissors to pry open the frozen junction box and manages to get it open despite difficult conditions.
Loses grip on scissors and the phone receiver due to cold and clumsiness.
Successfully catches the phone receiver by the cord after it falls and manages to plug it in, getting a dial tone.
Tries to communicate clearly with emergency operator despite nervousness and connection problems.
Fails to maintain phone connection and drops the receiver after receiving a shock.
Attempts to make a phone call from a dangerous position, but the line goes dead and she shows momentary despair.
Climbs down a telephone pole despite difficult conditions, but falls and becomes dazed.
Recognizes danger and flees quickly upon encountering dead bodies, showing situational awareness.
Stops abruptly upon seeing the dead teenagers, which may indicate hesitation or fear.
Scrambles across the seat to put distance between herself and the corpse, showing presence of mind and quick reaction.
Cowers against the passenger door, indicating fear and hesitation.
Hauls the dead body after her despite its heavy weight, demonstrating physical effort and determination.
Slips on ice and falls, losing balance and control.
Notices oncoming headlights only a split-second before they arrive, showing delayed perception.
Leaps into action and scrambles to her feet quickly after initial shock, showing ability to overcome fear.
Cannot open stuck car door despite frantic efforts, showing limited success under pressure.
Checks on our guy's lifeless body with care inside the warm snowplow cab.
Too stunned to speak when the snowplow driver stops to help.
Yanks on the car door handle frantically, trying to open it despite failing.
Shields her eyes from the bright headlights, showing awareness of her environment.
Checks on our guy's body after transfer to snowplow, showing concern and composed behavior.
Calmly buckles her seatbelt while facing a dangerous oncoming vehicle, showing composure.
Disagrees with the snowplow driver by stating 'It's not Tom...', indicating honesty and straightforwardness.
Eases the guy's body back inside the snowplow and onto the seat beside her after the crash.
Rouses from daze and carefully places injured guy back inside the car.
Immediately recognizes danger when she sees the snowplow driver heading down a steep embankment.
Unbuckles seatbelt and exits vehicle quickly to intervene.
Starts descending steep, slippery ravine after snowplow driver, despite hazardous conditions.
Slips and slides down ravine, showing limited physical control or preparation for descent.
Stops snowplow driver from further action when highway patrol car is found overturned, showing awareness and attempt to manage situation calmly.
Catches snowplow driver's arm to stop him from attempting to rescue trapped patrolman near a fire.
Firmly insists that the patrolman is already dead, preventing rescue efforts.
Grabs the snowplow driver and pulls him away from the crawling cop, commanding him to move, preventing him from being caught and frozen.
Struggles to climb the snowy slope and almost falls back towards the cop but perseveres and reaches the road despite exhaustion.
Struggles to escape danger, showing desperation and vulnerability.
Acts urgently and determinedly to start the snowplow to escape threat.
Sobs and gasps visibly when confronted with threat, showing emotional openness and sincerity.
Hauls herself up from a ravine despite exhaustion and fear, tries multiple times to start the snowplow engine, notices power light on CB and attempts to use the microphone to call for help.
Panics and hyperventilates upon realizing escape is futile and seeing the ghost approaching, then immediately throws open the door and scrambles out.
Stops after turning off her cellphone and looks at the ghost, then decides to follow him despite exhaustion.
Calls out to Guy's ghost, expressing understanding and empathy for his explanation.
Continues to push forward despite being exhausted and devastated, showing determination but also a willingness to sustain connection.
Remembers her cellphone and retrieves it to look at a photo of Our Guy.
Snaps a picture of Ride Board Guy with her camera phone before putting it away quickly.
Challenges Guy's expectation that she should talk to him during the ride, showing confidence and assertiveness.
Attempts to diffuse tension with casual banter and strikes up conversation as an olive branch.
Mocks Guy's claim about attending the same school, showing awareness and a sense of humor.
Fails to remember attending a large philosophy class despite Guy’s hint, indicating limits to her recall in social situations.
Challenges Guy's assumption about her major, questions why he assumes things about her since they just met.
Enjoys the pained look on Guy's face when she says she's an engineering major, lets him twist before explaining she took Philosophy for an easy grade.
Engages Guy in conversation, asks about his final exam extra credit question, shows interest.
Looks at Guy as if he's nuts when he recites Nietzsche, makes a blunt joke about Nietzsche dying of syphilis.
Throws her arms instinctively around Guy's neck, humors his effort despite discomfort.
Says 'Thanks' after being carried inside and gives him a look before heading off.
Insists on not being carried inside despite Guy's offer.
Calls out for help when locked in the bathroom, tries to communicate through vent, shows frustration when laughed at but persists in opening the door.
Tries the passenger door handle but it is stuck; waits for Guy to open it instead of forcing it or finding another way in.
Expresses panic and insists the Guy return to the highway when he takes a scenic detour on a rough road.
Fails to calm down or assert a more effective plan in response to the unexpected detour; shows panic more than confident problem-solving.
Shares personal family holiday struggles openly with Guy.
Engages Guy in conversation about family traditions, showing interest.
Scowls at Guy after misunderstanding, but corrects him directly.
Questions Guy aggressively and distrustfully, demanding honesty.
Considers fleeing when the guy is distracted but decides it is too risky.
Shows curiosity about the situation and walks out to investigate, sharing the experience with the guy.
Scrambles across the front seat and locks the car door, preventing Guy from entering and ignoring his calls for help.
Refuses to communicate, keeps eyes down, and dismisses Guy with a hostile remark despite his panic and pleas.
Makes a clear decision to lock the car doors and isolate herself from Guy in a moment of fear and panic.
Frantically tries to use her cellphone for help despite no signal, showing some attempt at problem-solving under stress.
Acts in a paranoid and near-hysterical manner, ignoring the Guy’s attempts to communicate and possibly escalating the situation.
Responds sarcastically to Guy's suggestions and ignores his concern.
Cowers inside the car, scared by Guy's aggressive behavior.
Doesn't intervene or attempt to help Guy with the stuck car door, remains inside the car scared when Guy acts out in frustration.
Sarcastically responds to Guy's remarks about the duct tape and coming along, indicating a lack of constructive engagement.
Listens and watches carefully as Guy leaves and tries to understand the situation without panicking.
Screams and brandishes scissors defensively at Guy out of fear and mistrust.
Expresses paranoia and mistrust toward Guy despite his attempts to calm her.
Tries to communicate about the stranger she saw, showing openness in sharing information.
Refuses to get in the car with the stalker despite freezing, holding scissors defensively and staying wary.
Hesitates and struggles with the decision to seek shelter, showing vulnerability and fear.
Notices the clock on the dashboard is incorrect and points it out, showing attentiveness.
Notices the trickle of blood on Guy's head and calls attention to it, showing awareness and concern.
Questions Guy about his origins, noticing inconsistencies in his story.
Engages Guy to elicit more truthful information.
Forgets groceries in the parking lot, causing inconvenience and frustration.
Calmly admits her mistake without defensiveness.
Shows knowledge of specific food items (cornichons), indicating attentiveness to detail.
Calls Guy 'Asshole' after his teasing, showing her irritation but engaging with him.
Refuses to give up scissors despite Guy's insistence and physical coercion.
Shows terror and resists when Guy grabs her and takes the scissors.
Warns guy not to look while she pees, showing consideration for privacy.
Screams and alerts guy to the danger of the dark figures, showing trust and reliance on him.
Decides to follow the figures rather than stay alone, indicating some level of trust and cooperation.
Decides to give up the chase and return to the car, showing a moment of retreat or hesitation.
Gasps and immediately pursues the black stranger after spotting him again, demonstrating alertness and determination.
Keeps pace with the stranger to prevent him from vanishing, showing persistence and physical capability.
Notices the stranger’s bound wrists and ankles, quickly assessing a key detail of the situation.
Reaches toward the stranger without apparent caution, leading to her experiencing a powerful, harmful supernatural jolt.
Worries about Guy, tries to explain the presence of another person even though unsure.
Winces in pain but does not complain, allows Guy to gently examine her frostbitten hand.
Uses duct tape and newspapers to seal the car window to protect both from cold.
Softly asks him to hold her, showing vulnerability and trust.
Comfortably spoons with him to share warmth and support.
Expresses fear honestly, sharing her feelings openly.
Recognizes the highway patrolman is attempting a shake-down scam quickly and quietly warns the Guy.
Takes initiative by digging cash out of her purse to deal with the corrupt cop efficiently.
Stops the Guy from reacting impulsively, demonstrating control and experience in handling tense situations.
Offers money and tries to engage the highway patrolman with friendly Christmas spirit despite difficult situation.
Shows worry and fear when the patrolman's attitude turns hostile and menacing, trying to de-escalate the situation.
Knows that burning hands means circulation is returning, showing some medical/basic first aid knowledge.
Searches for medication in purse despite poor light and no contacts, then puts on glasses to help find it, showing adaptability and persistence.
Notices newspaper clipping stuck in the window, reads and pieces together important information about the mysterious figures and accident, showing observational skills and intelligence.
Shyly asks about having to pee, follows plan to use bottle without complaint.
Shakes head, eyes full of fear, does not want to sleep but respects Guy's watch plan.
Responds to teasing with a short 'Stop talking.'
Agrees to use the makeshift bathroom solution and manages to urinate discreetly into the bottle despite discomfort.
Expresses fear and is reluctant to sleep, showing emotional struggle during a stressful situation.
Confronts Guy about the suspicious urine bottle, noticing blood, and asks direct questions about his injury and condition.
Catches herself awkwardly when mentioning 'relationship' but quickly recovers and refocuses on situation.
Looks on helplessly as Guy experiences pain, unable to assist further.
Determines that Guy needs help urgently and insists on trying to hike out despite danger.
Tries to find a way to call for help by creatively examining the surroundings and salvaging a phone.
Acknowledges her fear but resolves to climb the telephone pole despite risk to save Guy.
Smiles encouragingly and tenderly kisses Guy to comfort him.
Looks at Guy with fierce determination to reassure him in a frightening situation.
Leaves the warmth and safety of the car to brave extreme cold conditions to help Guy.
Attempts to open the junction box despite difficulties to get help, calmly communicates with the operator to request emergency assistance for her injured friend.
Turns down radio volume, tries to communicate with unconscious guy, checks his condition, uses interior light to better assess him.
Reacts with overwhelming terror and hysteria, unable to maintain composure or act decisively when guy appears dead.
Cries and repeatedly apologizes while struggling to move the dead body away from the car
Exhibits terror and panic trying to escape an oncoming car but still attempts to open the stuck door to safety
Urges the snowplow driver to leave quickly, pulls him away from the crawling, frostbitten cop to keep him safe.
Climbs away from the danger and does not attempt to assist the cop struggling below, focusing on her own escape.
